resources.string: Parents: please enter a PIN above. You will use this PIN to confirm your child\'s progress on their quest!

Welcome to Surgery Quest! Throughout the day, you will be completing tasks to prepare you for your mission to build the first colony on Mars. You will meet new people and find certain items today at the hospital. They will all help you get to Mars! Are you ready for your trip to Mars? Press start below to prepare for liftoff!
You did it! Great job on completing your mission. You will now be teleported back to Earth. We thank you for playing Surgery Quest and wish you a speedy recovery!

Your first task is to get the pre-flight checks done and make sure you\'re ready for take off. During your check-in, you\'ll meet with the secretary to make sure you\'re all set for your surgery day. Prepare for liftoff!

Mars is about 35 million miles away so it\'ll be a lot of waiting before we get there. Your task now is to keep yourself entertained while the doctors get ready to for you. Play three games in the waiting room!
Oh no an alien! Wait this is a friendly alien that just wants to learn more about how you\'ve been growing. Press the done button after the nurse has taken your height and weight.

Every astronaut needs a tracker bracelet. Don\'t forget to put on your two tracker bracelets so that mission control can track your progress while you are on Mars. If you look closely, you can read information about yourself and your mission on your bracelets.

It\'s not safe to step out onto Mars in your normal Earth clothes. You\'re gonna need to pick out your very own space suit for this space mission. After you have new scrubs on, you\'re now ready for the Mars atmosphere.

What is that beeping noise coming from your ship\'s controls? It\'s your life monitor systems! See the picture above? Look for a screen in the room that looks the same to check on your heart rate. This will tell you how many times your heart beats every minute.
Here\'s another important part to prepare for your adventure. Your blood pressure has to be at a normal scale for us to proceed!
Heartbeat rate is important to get prepared to travel to Mars! We are here to check your heartbeat to make sure you are good to go!

You\'re going to need an oxygen tank to breathe on Mars but it turns out that the air you\'ve brought smells a little weird. Meet with your air technician to choose a scented chapstick to rub on your mask so that the air you breathe in smells better.
The atmosphere here at space is different from Earth. Please use this otoscope to check any symptoms on your ear before you proceed to next step

Incoming call from mission control! It\'s the chief operations officer checking in for final preparations before you get to Mars. With all your earlier tasks complete it\'s just about time for the surgery. You are in good hands, follow the surgeon\'s instructions and we will check in with you afterwards. Good luck with your surgery!
Good job the mission was a success! Everything went well and you\'ll soon be on your way back home. We hope you feel better!
You\'ve spent a long time eating just space food on this mission. Enjoy this special Earth treat!
It\'s still a while before you get back home from your mission. Sit back, relax, and enjoy your favorite shows while you\'re on your way back from Mars.
You did it! All tasks have been completed and you get to ride back home. Grab a balloon!
